snippet.textDisplay: 10:44 Latency problems can be reduced if you turn off cross play and and select region. But the main problem here is not the game but your ISP. And then we have a million other factors the game team has no control over.

snippet.textDisplay:
Once the copium wears off and we can start being honest with ourselves, we can then all admit that this game won't last ten months; let alone ten years. 

 If this game is going to survive, wipes need to be mandatory, delete the rolling spawn system, reduce the amount of raiders on the map, increase the number and lethality of the arc and implement a matchmaking system that sort players based on a pvp aggression scale. In it's current state, this game is far to mediocre for the vast majority of players to suffer having to deal with all of the griefers and rats. New content is irrelevant if the most toxic part of the player base doesn't allow people to engage with it.
snippet.textOriginal:
Once the copium wears off and we can start being honest with ourselves, we can then all admit that this game won't last ten months; let alone ten years. 

 If this game is going to survive, wipes need to be mandatory, delete the rolling spawn system, reduce the amount of raiders on the map, increase the number and lethality of the arc and implement a matchmaking system that sort players based on a pvp aggression scale. In it's current state, this game is far to mediocre for the vast majority of players to suffer having to deal with all of the griefers and rats. New content is irrelevant if the most toxic part of the player base doesn't allow people to engage with it.

snippet.textDisplay: Hey I’m a player of arc raiders and I love ur game a lot I have a great idea. I notice a lot of people complaining about losing loot. So I thought of something. Gold augments and gold keys. It starts out has a blue prints..  the materials for the gold augment are material from 1 matriarch  2 bastions 2 leapers 2 rocketeers .  The augment allow 1 safe gun spot  and 4 safe pockets. To get gold key  1 queen 1 matriarch 2 bastions 2 leapers 2 rocketeers. Key allows you to loot a gold augment and all its gear. 1 key per character . This allows players to not worry about losing loot in pvp and encourages pvp to work together

snippet.textDisplay: I’ve gone from being in love with this game when it felt like it was everyone versus the Arc and looting and missions felt important, to now not wanting to even play anymore.  Round after round I just encounter players who don’t care if they live or die and don’t do missions or loot at all.  They just hide and spring surprise attacks where in a map like Stella Montis, it’s hard to get away and heal.  So the guy that shoot first usually wins.  I get that it happens at times and is part of the game.  I’ve had 5 rounds in a row with this crap now while trying to find a flow controller.  They camp med bay knowing players doing quests are coming there.  A solution to deincentivize PvP is needed sadly

snippet.textDisplay: All these problems are greatly magnified by streamers and content creators like this guy who can't just say "yeah the game is great", they have to cater to whiners too and display some critical thinking. And so we get gLaRinG ISSueS and similar hilarious bullshit, tiny nuances that become Game Breaking Problems, and so on. snippet.textDisplay:
The Truth About ARC Raiders Streamers...
The online discussion has been completely soured because of streamers and their annoying, repetitive content . They've already done the excessive grind to level 75, and now they just repeat the same broken meta, completely ruining the experience for everyone else.

The main problem is that streamer content is driven by finding and exploiting issues, which then becomes the annoying, repetitive content that forces everyone to play a miserable meta.

Repetitive and Annoying Content: Streamers constantly run custom, expensive loadouts that are only viable if they get a fresh map. When they don't, they immediately extract for a reset, making their live content a boring, constant reset loop. This isn't entertainment; it's a frustrating highlight of the game's flaws.

Ruining the Game with Exploits: Streamers are the ones who ruined the key room system by broadcasting how to use glitches that allowed players to break into loot locations without the necessary key card. This imbalance in the community was caused by those players who leaned heavily into the exploit to juice their loadouts insanely quick, effectively ruining the progression for honest players. They're about to be exposed as frauds because they only know how to play the game the cheap way.

Ruining the Experience with Meta-Chasing: Their content is geared toward farming repetitive trial challenges, like those requiring damage to flying enemies, which boils down to repeating the same farming loops using snitch scanners. Streamers constantly do this same, uninspired farming content to rack up tens of thousands of points, forcing others to do the same to compete].

Do Not Meddle in Game Creators' Jobs
The most frustrating part is their meddling in the game creator's jobs with their constant, uninformed complaints and suggestions.

Demanding Unfair Weapon Balance: Streamers constantly complain about weapon balance, not because they care about the game's health, but because they need an unfair edge for their content. The Venador, for instance, remains the go-to for most players thanks to streamers popularizing its exploit-like efficiency. They find every weapon glitch (like the Il Toro animation cancel) and quickly make it the annoying meta. They then act like they are experts, demanding developers introduce more technical tools when they are the ones who broke the balance in the first place.

Exacerbating Technical Issues: Their aggressive, high-risk playstyles, purely for "content," are what make technical issues like desync  feel so much worse. They constantly demand complete overhauls to systems like quests and blueprints, acting like they know how to design a better game.

The Advice to Streamers:

Stop ruining the game and creating this annoying, repetitive content. Your job is to entertain, not to dictate game design or find every exploit to make the game miserable for the casual player. Do not meddle in game creators' jobs like you know something about it. The developers would have an easier time addressing these issues, if you would just stick to playing the game as intended

snippet.textDisplay:
I really can’t agree with the idea that your loadout affects when you spawn into a match. I always hate joining maps that are already in progress, no matter what gear I bring. Honestly, this feature should just be removed. I’d rather wait a few extra minutes in matchmaking than spawn into a half-finished match where everything’s already looted and other players already have all the advantages. Whenever that happens, I just leave right away — there’s just no point staying. 

Another issue is the lack of spawn protection. I even got killed once right after spawning, which is just unacceptable (not sure if it’s been fixed).

I do agree, though, that blueprints need a serious rework. Basic blueprints and powerful ones like Hullcracker or Wolfpack should be obtainable as quest rewards. But all blueprints should still remain findable on the maps as well — just with better balancing. Right now it’s way off. I’ve spent around 65 hours topside and only got about 37 blueprints (mostly thanks to friends giving me their extras). Without that help, I’d probably be stuck at maybe 25.

snippet.textDisplay: Custom loadouts should always be prioritized over free ones for spawns, this is a given and a big oversight on Embark's part honestly. The Venator DOES NOT need a nerf to its damage output, it fires 2 rounds per trigger pull, this is logical. It should definitely consume 2 rounds per shot from its magazine however. This is all it needs. The Rattler and Bettina need attention, the Rattler 1 is incapable of putting a player down in a single magazine even without a shield (90 dmg) and only reloads 2 bullets at a time. Make it make sense Embark! The Bettina has too low a DPS for its ammo grade and has too high a wear rate. Why would anyone bother considering the cost? IMO, higher grade weapons should have a lower wear rate and greater accuracy compared to lower tier weapons. Maybe even higher upgradability. This would make the rarer weapons worth the effort and cost. Common weapons no upgrade, uncommon 1 upgrade, rare 2 upgrades and epics 3 upgrades. Or maybe how many attachments they can run? Something to differentiate the common guns from the rarer ones without touching the power of any of them. This would represent the greater quality and fit and finish of the blue and purple/pink weapons over the white and green. Lastly, they should allow people to insure at least one of their guns, this would go a long way in reducing the complaints over rats and extraction campers. It would be really easy for them to implement, the system already exists in the engine.

snippet.textDisplay: On our shared account here: You are spot on on all of your points; I just watched a video by Aidan Titled about how the Security Breach skill isn’t worth it. In it he raided 100 Security lockers and got 2 Blueprints, JUST 2! That’s just absurd! You dump all of those points into that skill branch and that’s your reward, trash, not to mention having to fight other players off to raid these in time. As a Solo player I would really like ALL of these Blueprints to be completely random, you could open a locker and blam, there’s the seeker grenade blueprint. At this point I have been grieved so much during extraction that I now hide for a few times when the extract is called and wait it out, 7 out of 10 times I will hear some poor luck player getting murdered by some camping scum. Plus If I wait it out and I hear a player stay around after they had that window to leave and didn’t, that tell me all I need to know about what type of player they are. I’m at level 39 and have yet to kill a single raider, it’s not how I want to play nor is it why i bought the game in the first place. While i am on a rant, there needs to be player immunity once a player interacts with the extraction console. These scum that kill you with no time to loot you is just senseless bs IMO. And before anyone says the same “ it’s an extraction shooter blah blah blah, my opinions are just as valid as yours so save it.

snippet.textDisplay: In terms of the Blueprints, I think it's a fine system the little bit of RNG in finding them is what's going to make every season just a little different for everyone. It also adds value to the PvP element of the game, as if your in map and say don't have access to the Anvil blueprint, taking on that Raider that's rocking the Anvil is more valuable. Without the blueprint reset the game would stale out way faster since it would essentially eliminate and entire subset of loot. I do think adding quests that could get some blueprints is fine, like by the end of the quests you get all the uncommon (green) weapons and gear leaving many of the Rare's and Epics as your chase items. Definitely interested to see what Embark does but it seems like they know their game and vision (for better or worse).

snippet.textDisplay: The simplest fix i can imagine is for some events, particularly the Harvester/Queen and Matriarch, is to have them SOMETIMES spawn as a a real raid. Disable PvP, increase the round timer, and make them harder to defeat. This could be done by buffing their health, adding additional/more frequent enemy spawns(swarms of wasps, rocketeers and more bastion/bombardier, etc etc). Then, in addition to looting, have additional rewards given at end of round based on damage done, healing done, number of enemies killed, etc etc. This allows for more incentive to contribute, treats the bosses like actual bosses, and both gives certain players an opportunity to feel a more cooperative focused gameplay loop. It fits the theme too, since these giant bosses SHOULD be the one thing that brings disparate Raider groups together, if only so often and temporarily.

snippet.textDisplay:
I noticed that you didn't mention the camping, griefing, exploiting and hacking some pvp players are engaging in, many of which outright state is simply to grief other players. There are youtube channels dedicated to openly doing this and it's openly stated by some on forums and yet Embark, who said their game was PVE/PVP says nothing and does nothing. AR has an AMAZING community, many of which are either stopping or cutting back on their playing because these players are succeeding in their efforts to ruin the fun for others. If something is not done you'll end up with the worst of the worst and the good members of the community, who are the vast majority, will simply quit playing. When that happens a game rarely recovers and instead of seeing Raiders grow and flourish it will slowly die hateful grief fueled death.

That should be Embark's largest priority as these same griefers are the majority of the ones engaged in exploits, hacks, spawn camping, etc. The Spawn rotation and balancing loot availability should be #2, followed by Blueprints at #3. Many of us have nothing left to strive for except Blueprints and now after the extreme nerfs to availability and all that's dropping +95% of the time is the same 2 dozen blueprints, there's really little reason to play, especially with Embark taking a "hands off" approach to griefing. Funny how it's ok to ruin the fun of other players but a gun that damages Arc too efficiently is treated like an urgent matter...

Mark my words, if the griefing is not addressed and Embark does not act to curtail it then Raiders will go downhill from here. Some of you might not care but remember, less players means less revenue/resources which means a limited lifespan and far less additional content. (Plus the only players you'll have will be the kind that desire to make you miserable)

snippet.textDisplay: 3:08 - Eh... I think this would be a horrible thing to do. Free loadouts are *essential* for newbies and people who are just not any good at the game - those people should also get the most time in the world to spread out and loot some things before all the PvP hunters show up to mow them down. snippet.textDisplay: The things you've outlined in this video I agree with, but there's so much more.  let's add the inventory management simulator that you have to go through with your inventory because there's literally no quality of life for the inventory in this game.  if you're not a p v p person in this game, actively winning and losing material, then you're going to be hoarding material.And the stash space you need to manage is like half the time you're playing the game.  saved custom loadouts... this is a big one, because when you create a load out, you can use that loadout over and over again.But as soon as you go to a free loadout that freeload replaces your custom loadout.  every time I bounce between a custom loadout and a free loadout, I don't want to constantly go into my inventory and rebuild the stupid custom loadout.  i mean, do the devs want you to play the game by dropping into a match or do they want you to manage your loadout and inventory for a combined total amount of time that probably adds to hours.  p v p in solo's I think has got to go.  take p v p out of solos, but make the arc four times harder.  once you take the p v p out of solo's since solos are already like ninety five percent friendly on PC Anyway, then what you do is you make it so that people in solos can actually legitimately group up together to where the people become a proper group to where you can see the person's name above their head like you can in group play and there is no friendly fire.

snippet.textDisplay: The expedition system is so trash. On one hand I want to reset my Skill Tree and my Level because I made a few bad decisions there, but on the other hand I don't want to lose everything else. They should really add the option to only reset your Points and Level, especially because a lot of people leveled the wrong things because of the bad skill descriptions.

snippet.textDisplay:
I have no idea what they are thinking with the blueprint system. I gave the medium gun parts blueprint to a guy which I found in a match yesterday that still didn't have it. And I lack so many so I bought a hull cracker at an earlier point for the time when I got the quests and needed items from the rocketeer but then they nerfed it. So its completely useless to kill things it was made to kill, and the rocketeer is just dumb to play against. Sometimes it just fires once it sigth pass by you and you almost dead. You don't even see that it gets a lock, because it just fires when it's trying to balance itself from left or right or back to front when it just fires a shot completely random. And if wolf packs were more reasonable and not so rare I would use them all the time but this game got a load of things to fix like either let you keep blueprints, making the new versions v2 and slightly better at certain things or make the season 1 blueprints unusable, but they must have thought of this right? If there are people that are loading up friends characters with items that will let them skip the whole process for them they will ruin the game for the rest. And some will just leave. Others might adapt. But im done with this game if they can't find a better system for the blueprints tbh.... Being able to craft blueprints from items found in the world. Let's say "old schematics for automatic medium ammo rifle/gun and craft them into medium gun parts ammo for guns. The reason I'm adding for guns is if it's possible to craft it you need to have more starting recipes if you don't randomly find it in the world. . It really doesn't matter because the fact is that unless you are full on pvping every match you are lagging behind because you need things from areas of all parts of the map and when you never spawn in at points where stuff you need are the atmosphere of the game is gonna be pretty different in season 2 and I'm getting really tired of lagging behind just because it's impossible for me to kill a rocketeer just to get killed before I can loot it. After they turned the hull cracker into dogshit your fight with the rocketeer can last long enough to have the whole map converging on the parts dropping once you kill it and leave you with nothing... No there are many things that ruined season 1 and have made impossible to compete and complete all the quests alone because I truly want a reset. I think the game already needed a reset at the point where blueprint drops were changed and lowered because that was so unfair and such a fundamental change in the middle of a season even if it was the first should be changed to will be rebalanced during the expedition window. Because it made such a huge gap between people that already had most of the items and had friends they could play with 24/7.. I don't have friends that play this game. And queuing against premades in this game is just being cannon fodder for the premades. Yea, there are loads of things to change for the next season and I hope embark has been paying attention because this season will make or break this game. It already sold half of what I thought it would, and there are so many things the game should have started with, like an open beta so they could iron out the kinks and balance issues that now have split the community in three. Those who joined late and just try to keep up. Those who joined alone and are struggling to keep up and catch up by all means and ruining the game for everyone else. And : those who are already max level with all the blueprints and have found a bunch of friends to go out and farm items they need for the next season if embark hasn't locked that shit down.
And I part with some last words. If the game doesn't get some catchup mechanisms to make up for the huge flaws the game has got because of their not so well thought out fixes in the middle of a season this game is inherently flawed and will fail after the second season. There is no reason they couldn't wait to fix weapon balances until the expedition window, I don't even mind having some weapons being changed and or harder to get in some seasons and this is why you start a game like this without all the features locked in. It pisses me so fricking off that I will probably miss the first expedition window because they didn't choose to start the game out by balancing all the stuff out. Then reset and start the countdown for the first expedition. Frick off embark,

snippet.textDisplay:
It needs a lot of content at endgame for continuing replayability if it ever wants to be positioned as a live-service title with a shelf life of 10+ years. It's being positioned as a lite Tarkov game with some pve.

Beyond this, it doesn't even satisfy either objectives for rewarding progression with fun content. People have fun with mechanics and features which has nothing to do with deep and replayable content loops. It's too light either way and can't compare to other pvp- and pve-rich games. The dev team is going to find out that it's nearly impossible to satisfy players because pve and pvp are very different experiences. It's a balancing issue that plagues any dev team that tries to balance these differences within the same space. 

This has been an issue for more than 20 years and no company has successfully achieved triple A experiences in a fully pvpve or pvevp title.

I have a sense that devs are paying attention to this and will trigger a vision that will fully explore a richer, narrower, and deeper experiences split both ways and more akin to an mmorpg that successfully captures triple A experiences in both modes of play. This team doesn't have the resources to create this anytime soon. They have said this which is unfortunate. It's going to be too slow to churn out anything meaningful for long-term play for anyone.

snippet.textDisplay:
I believe the biggest issues facing Arc Raiders are cheaters (both the console and PC cheaters!). While the rate may be extremely rare currently (I've had my kit returned twice in 50+ topside hours, 80 hours recorded in Steam), once on PC (crossplay) and recently on PS5 (no crossplay). If the number of games affected by unfair play go from 1% of your games to 10% of your games, it will totally kill the game. Once this happens, it doesn't even matter if you never come across a cheater. Every PvP death will cause players to start questioning whether that was a fair fight, whether they we disadvantaged or destined to lose. This happened to Tarkov and it destroyed the games momentum, hard. 

The current anti cheat system is not sufficient. Embark really should look into systems like Javelin and increased server side detections. They should also look into limiting console hardware to first party only (or just detect and ban he most common 'cheat' devices that are on the market). 

Cheats, bugs and exploits can kill extraction shooters so quickly due to the higher reward structure that incentivises these human scum to cheat in the first place.

snippet.textDisplay:
Free loadouts should always be late in the raid. Never early. Custom loadout should always get a fresh raid. Never a late spawn past 27 min. 

Free loadouts need a rework, or always come late in the raid. 

They also really should add a PvE event into the rotation. All loot containers are dropped to basic materials(Scrappy stuff). Trials are turned off in the event. 

All players have to work together to get out alive. If they fail to achieve the goal, they all get nuked. A colossal arc boss guarding the only extraction maybe. Idk.

 I’m not using decent gear in any raid at this point because I don’t know what  the stash value requirements are going to be for max expedition skill points. I’m turning in the last 40k of provision materials, and I’m done with all the expedition steps. Basically all I have to do PvE wise is farm trinkets, and fruit for the expedition.  (Having stash value tied to how many expedition skill points you get is bad design. It encourages hoarding of valuable items and gear) I am bringing up my coin count back to a million now that my expedition is nearly done. I could probably have close to 2 million coin in the next few weeks, but what’s the amount we need for max skill points? I’m not using any epic or legendary items until I know. 

I’m a solo player almost exclusively. Other than the occasional PvP fight because someone shoots at me, there’s really nothing exciting going on, or to look forward to. 

I like the world enough to kinda stick around, and the PvP doesn’t really bother me. I enjoy it. They did a good job with it. I’m not the type to farm casual friendly PvE enjoyers so it’s not my main focus in the game. A PvE event would really add something to look forward to for myself and many other PvE enjoyers.

snippet.textDisplay:
Blueprint system could be better.
Have rng drops sure, but maybe introduce a research option.
Find a legendary weapon? Hand it in at the research station for the nerds in speranza to look at. Let them pull it apart over time and have a quest line requiring you to secure items to assist their investigations. End state is you can now construct the item.
Perhaps blueprint + research completed = cheaper build cost, in the event you achieve both.

Sure this will allow sweat lords to gain items faster, but they do that anyway. This method will at least allow casuals to keep up.

snippet.textDisplay:
Loading in late = less loot, harder to extract.

Surely it makes logical sense to prioritise loading those who have more gear (and thus a better chance at survival) in late.

Free load out prioritised to load early makes the free load out viable as a dash in, quick loot and get out strategy.

Or maybe you risk wasting your time by spawn camping to fight someone with higher tier items, the advantage being you have the jump on them.

People need to stop crying that they were out played by a free load out and lost their gear.

You should always approach an extraction expecting a rat to be waiting /watching. 

Nothing is irreplaceable. The basic weapons leveled up are viable against higher tiered items, and they easy enough to achieve over and over even for a casual gamer.

Plan your run, balance your risk appetite and gear accordingly.

If you are not confident and would feel sad losing your bobcat to an extraction camper, bring a raider hatch key and don't pick a night run.

Feeling more confident / don't care if you lose  yellow pixels because your quite happy with grey ones, go balls to the wall on a night raid.

The threat/fear the game system currently evokes is what actually makes it good.

snippet.textDisplay: Totally agree with most of these points. Particularly the blueprints. I've got three I think after 30 hours and two weeks worth of playing. It's a fabulous game, so much atmosphere and has to be the best sound design in game ever, but battling your way to a lift and getting mullered by a camper just isn't fair. I would like there to be a choice. A system which puts you on a map where PVP isn't a thing. e.g. Dam PVE or Dam PVP and then people who want to go and do that can. For me this is what will not make this a long term game.

snippet.textDisplay:
My biggest critique of the loadout and late spawn suggestion is this: why wouldn’t I just run an ultra cheap setup by crafting a basic Stitcher One with a small amount of light ammo and a shield that only costs rubber parts and other nearly nonexistent materials to almost always guarantee that I start at the beginning of a match? It’s absolutely worth it.

If anything, the suggested change would punish newer players who don’t have materials, while established players will always be able to meet the requirement to start early. That would leave free loadouts users who would likely not have much mats stuck in the back half of the match with fewer opportunities to loot.

snippet.textDisplay: With much respect - and I know this runs contrarian to this channel's POV, but mixing PVE and PVP has always been an incredibly difficult task for the market. Having been in game development my entire professional life and running studios, any good CMO knows that the PVE and PVP players are in different camps, want different things and expect a different experience from their time in game. Surely there are folks in the middle, but the market data supports that games like HD2 work because they are focused on one side of the coin, and most battle royales such as PUBG and Fortnite serves the other. Mixing the two almost never ever ever ever works. And the data to support this is overwhelming - Dune Awakening, every single MMO etc. Now Arc has done arguably the best job of trying to find that elusive middle ground....but ultimately has failed to find it. Folks are divided. Embark has a choice. Door one is to continue to do what they are doing  - this is unlikely to work long term because the toxicity of the mixing will cause too many "friendly players" to leave. Door two is to start making major tweaks as Cody suggests to spawn points, loadout rules and whatnot. This is likely to make some differences but unfortunately does not fundamentally address the foundational issue - which is there are multiple camps and they are firmly entrenched. Door 3 is to provide a PVE option where Loot is completely separate, ARCs are far more prominent in PVE mode etc. This is the obvious choice. And doing this will only enhance the game's popularity. It wont affect those that continue to login to the PVPVE mode - so those who want that experience need not apply as a change like this won't negatively impact the game.

It wont affect those that continue to login to the PVPVE mode - so those who want that experience need not apply as a change like this won't negatively impact the game.

snippet.textDisplay:
The matchmaking system from my experience can be easily manipulated to allow duos/trios into solo lobbies especially on console (I play both PC & console). 
It seems for example if you turn crossplay off on Xbox/PS5, search as a trio and when your wait time exceeds 2-3 minutes, BAM! Trio’s in a solo lobby. 
This is the problem with suggestive systems instead of hard systems. 
The amount of bugs in the game gives me DayZ vibes and I honestly find it quite disappointing.
